content:
Diagnosis:	Locally advanced prostate cancer

Staging:	T3bN1M0 acinar adenocarcinoma, Gleason 4+5=9
	PSA at diagnosis 32.1 (March 2024)
	Staging MRI 15/03/24: bilateral disease with extracapsular extension and seminal vesicle invasion
	PET-CT 22/03/24: FDG-avid bilateral external iliac nodes

MDT Discussion:	Case presented at Uro-oncology MDT 25/03/24
	Present: Urology, Medical Oncology, Clinical Oncology, Radiology, Pathology
	Evidence reviewed: MRI prostate, PET-CT, prostate biopsies
	Discussion points:
	1. High-risk disease with nodal involvement
	2. Good performance status, no significant comorbidities
	3. Patient preference for radical treatment

MDT Outcome:	Recommendation for combination therapy:
	1. Androgen deprivation therapy for 2 years
	2. Radical radiotherapy to prostate and pelvic nodes
	3. Consider docetaxel chemotherapy

Current Status:	Started Leuprorelin 3-monthly depot 11.25mg on 27/03/24
	PSA reduced to 28.4 (05/04/24)
	Tolerating hormonal therapy with mild hot flushes

Plan:	Review in combined clinic with Clinical Oncology in 2 weeks
	Discuss timing of radiotherapy and role of docetaxel

cancer_timeline.value: MRI shows bilateral disease with extracapsular extension and seminal vesicle invasion
PET-CT shows FDG-avid bilateral external iliac nodes

status_updates.value: High-risk locally advanced prostate cancer with nodal involvement. Initial response to hormonal therapy with falling PSA.
Mild hot flushes from hormonal therapy
Continuing Leuprorelin with early PSA response
Review in combined clinic with Clinical Oncology in 2 weeks to discuss radiotherapy and docetaxel
